params.delta: The caller's balance delta after adding liquidity; the sum of principal delta, fees accrued, and hook delta
params.feesAccrued: The fees accrued since the last time fees were collected from this position
params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the liquidity provider to be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the add liquidity call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook
returns._1: BalanceDelta The hook's delta in token0 and token1. Positive: the hook is owed/took currency, negative: the hook owes/sent currency

params.amount0: The amount of token0 being donated
params.amount1: The amount of token1 being donated
params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the donor to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the donate call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.key: The key for the pool being initialized
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the initialize call
params.sqrtPriceX96: The sqrt(price) of the pool as a Q64.96
params.tick: The current tick after the state of a pool is initialized

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.delta: The caller's balance delta after removing liquidity; the sum of principal delta, fees accrued, and hook delta
params.feesAccrued: The fees accrued since the last time fees were collected from this position
params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the liquidity provider to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the remove liquidity call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook
returns._1: BalanceDelta The hook's delta in token0 and token1. Positive: the hook is owed/took currency, negative: the hook owes/sent currency

params.delta: The amount owed to the caller (positive) or owed to the pool (negative)
params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the swapper to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the swap call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook
returns._1: int128 The hook's delta in unspecified currency. Positive: the hook is owed/took currency, negative: the hook owes/sent currency

becomeKeeper(uint256).details: Implements king-of-the-hill mechanism where higher deposits replace current keeperThis function is protected against reentrancy by the order of operations:      1. Validate inputs and transfer new deposit first      2. Refund previous keeper (external call)      3. Update state variables

params.amount: The amount of DCA tokens to deposit to become keeper

params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the liquidity provider to be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the add liquidity call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.amount0: The amount of token0 being donated
params.amount1: The amount of token1 being donated
params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the donor to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the donate call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.key: The key for the pool being initialized
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the initialize call
params.sqrtPriceX96: The sqrt(price) of the pool as a Q64.96

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the liquidity provider to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the remove liquidity call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook

params.hookData: Arbitrary data handed into the PoolManager by the swapper to be be passed on to the hook
params.sender: The initial msg.sender for the swap call

returns._0: bytes4 The function selector for the hook
returns._1: BeforeSwapDelta The hook's delta in specified and unspecified currencies. Positive: the hook is owed/took currency, negative: the hook owes/sent currency
returns._2: uint24 Optionally override the lp fee, only used if three conditions are met: 1. the Pool has a dynamic fee, 2. the value's 2nd highest bit is set (23rd bit, 0x400000), and 3. the value is less than or equal to the maximum fee (1 million)

constructor.details: Sets up access control roles and default fee values. The developer address receives      both DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE and MANAGER_ROLE permissions.

params._developerAddress: The address that will receive developer fees and admin permissions.
params._poolManager: The Uniswap V4 pool manager contract.
params._positionManagerV4: The Uniswap V4 position manager for handling positions.
params._superDCAToken: The address of the SuperDCA token contract.

getHookPermissions().details: Enables beforeInitialize, afterInitialize, beforeAddLiquidity,      beforeRemoveLiquidity, and beforeSwap hooks. These are necessary for:      - Pool validation during initialization      - Dynamic fee enforcement      - Reward distribution during liquidity operations

returns._0: Hooks.Permissions struct with enabled hook flags.

returns.currentDeposit: The amount deposited by the current keeper
returns.currentKeeper: The address of the current keeper

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

isTokenListed(address).details: Returns false if no listing contract is set. Used by external contracts      to validate token eligibility before operations.

returns._0: True if the token is listed and approved for DCA, false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

returnSuperDCATokenOwnership().details: Only callable by DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE. Used when the gauge contract initially      owns the SuperDCA token but ownership needs to be returned to the admin for      configuration or other administrative purposes.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setFee(uint8,uint24).details: Only callable by MANAGER_ROLE. Fees are specified in basis points      (e.g., 5000 = 0.50%). Emits FeeUpdated event with old and new values.

params._feeType: The type of fee to update (INTERNAL, EXTERNAL, or KEEPER).
params._newFee: The new fee value in basis points.

setInternalAddress(address,bool).details: Only callable by MANAGER_ROLE. Internal addresses typically pay reduced      or zero fees to incentivize platform usage. Reverts on zero address.

params._isInternal: True to mark as internal, false to unmark.

setListing(address).details: Only callable by DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE. The listing contract determines      which tokens are approved for DCA operations.

params._listing: The address of the listing contract.

setStaking(address).details: Only callable by DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE. The staking contract handles reward      accrual calculations and distribution logic.

params.stakingAddr: The address of the deployed staking contract.

updateManager(address,address).details: Only callable by DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE. The manager role allows setting fees and      internal address designations.

params.newManager: The address of the new manager to grant the role to.
params.oldManager: The address of the current manager to revoke the role from.

afterAddLiquidity(address,(address,addre.notice: The hook called after liquidity is added

afterInitialize(address,(address,address.notice: The hook called after the state of a pool is initialized

afterRemoveLiquidity(address,(address,ad.notice: The hook called after liquidity is removed

afterSwap(address,(address,address,uint2.notice: The hook called after a swap

becomeKeeper(uint256).notice: Allows users to become the keeper by depositing more DCA tokens than the current keeper

beforeAddLiquidity(address,(address,addr.notice: The hook called before liquidity is added

beforeInitialize(address,(address,addres.notice: The hook called before the state of a pool is initialized

beforeRemoveLiquidity(address,(address,a.notice: The hook called before liquidity is removed

beforeSwap(address,(address,address,uint.notice: The hook called before a swap

constructor.notice: Initializes the SuperDCAGauge hook with core addresses and default fee structure.

developerAddress().notice: The address that receives developer fees from reward distributions.

externalFee().notice: Fee charged to external users (in basis points).

getHookPermissions().notice: Returns the hook permissions required by this contract.

internalFee().notice: Fee charged to whitelisted internal addresses (in basis points).

isInternalAddress(address).notice: Mapping to track which addresses are marked as internal for fee purposes.

isTokenListed(address).notice: Checks if a token is approved for DCA operations via the listing contract.

keeper().notice: The current keeper address who has deposited the highest amount.

keeperDeposit().notice: The amount of DCA tokens deposited by the current keeper.

keeperFee().notice: Fee charged to the current keeper (in basis points).

returnSuperDCATokenOwnership().notice: Transfers ownership of the SuperDCA token back to the caller.

setFee(uint8,uint24).notice: Updates one of the three fee types (internal, external, or keeper).

setInternalAddress(address,bool).notice: Marks or unmarks an address as internal for fee calculation purposes.

setListing(address).notice: Sets the external listing contract used for token listing queries.

setStaking(address).notice: Sets the external staking contract address for reward calculations.

staking().notice: External staking contract that manages reward calculations and distributions.

superDCAToken().notice: The address of the SuperDCA token contract.

updateManager(address,address).notice: Updates the manager role by revoking from old address and granting to new address.

@notice Enum defining the three types of fees charged to different user categories.
 @dev Used in setFee function to specify which fee type to update.

@notice Structure for holding token addresses and amounts in DCA operations.
 @dev Used internally for organizing token data during transactions.

@notice The address of the SuperDCA token contract.
 @dev This token must be one of the currencies in any pool using this hook.

@notice The address that receives developer fees from reward distributions.
 @dev Set during construction and can be updated via access control.

@notice Fee charged to whitelisted internal addresses (in basis points).
 @dev Typically set to 0 to incentivize internal usage.

@notice Fee charged to external users (in basis points).
 @dev Default is 5000 (0.50%) for regular users.

@notice Fee charged to the current keeper (in basis points).
 @dev Default is 1000 (0.10%) as an incentive for keeper services.

@notice Mapping to track which addresses are marked as internal for fee purposes.
 @dev Internal addresses pay reduced fees to encourage platform usage.

@notice The current keeper address who has deposited the highest amount.
 @dev Keeper gets reduced fees and can be replaced by higher deposits.

@notice The amount of DCA tokens deposited by the current keeper.
 @dev Used in the king-of-the-hill mechanism for keeper replacement.

@notice External staking contract that manages reward calculations and distributions.
 @dev Called during liquidity operations to accrue and distribute rewards.

@notice Emitted when SuperDCA token ownership is transferred back to admin.
 @param newOwner The address that received ownership of the SuperDCA token.
@notice Thrown when a pool is not configured with dynamic fees.
@notice Thrown when a keeper deposit amount is insufficient to replace current keeper.
@notice Thrown when a zero amount is provided where a positive amount is required.
@notice Thrown when an invalid pool fee configuration is detected.
@notice Thrown when a pool doesn't include the SuperDCA token as one of its currencies.
@notice Thrown when the Uniswap token address is not properly set.
@notice Thrown when caller is not the expected owner.
@notice Thrown when an invalid address is provided.
@notice Thrown when a zero address is provided where a valid address is required.

documentation.text:
@title SuperDCAGauge
 @notice A Uniswap V4 pool hook that implements dynamic fee management, keeper mechanisms, and reward distribution.
 @dev This contract serves as a central hook for DCA (Dollar Cost Averaging) pools, providing:
      - Dynamic fee structure based on user type (internal, external, keeper)
      - Keeper deposit system with king-of-the-hill replacement mechanism
      - Integration with external staking contract for reward distribution
      - Pool validation to ensure only SuperDCAToken pairs are used
      - Fee revenue distribution between community (via pool donations) and developer
 Architecture:
 - Hook Integration: Implements Uniswap V4 hooks for beforeInitialize, afterInitialize,
   beforeAddLiquidity, beforeRemoveLiquidity, and beforeSwap
 - Fee Management: Three-tier fee structure (internal: 0%, keeper: 0.10%, external: 0.50%)
 - Keeper System: Users can deposit DCA tokens to become keeper and get reduced fees
 - Reward Distribution: 50/50 split between community pool donations and developer payments
 - Access Control: Role-based permissions for admin operations and fee management
 Security Features:
 - Pool validation ensures only SuperDCAToken pairs can use this hook
 - Dynamic fee enforcement prevents bypassing fee structure
 - Safe minting with failure handling to prevent DoS attacks
 - Proper settlement and sync patterns for Uniswap V4 integration
